tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Jaeger is awesome. A good chunk of people in my class seem to not like it or him which I don\'t understand because it is easy. You come in every week spend an hour learning about the history of Cinema and specific genres and then you get to watch a movie almost all of which are great movies. I guess it\'s just my generation that can\'t appreciate it.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Great person, artist and teacher. Good sense of humor, always thoughtful feedback on students\' work. Bonus thing - very attractive guy.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Mr.Jaeger was excellent, among the best teachers I have had at HVCC. I wish he taught Photo 2. He encouraged creativity and was very willing to help those who wanted to learn. He has high standards, but you will learn so much with him.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Couldn\'t ask for a better professor. He made what seemed like a boring class become fascinating. Very knowledgeable in his field, willing to work with you and help if needed. Incredibly nice guy, always interested in hearing what his students have to say.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Loved this class; didn\'t want it to end. Encouraged to think independently and be creative, growing beyond my comfort zone. Prof taught well beyond the basics and as a practitioner. Responsive to student interests and very supportive. Used handouts instead of text--very efficient. Learned more than I ever thought possible in one semester.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Prof Jaeger was outstanding. He knows and loves his field. His lectures superbly blended photo/world history with personal stories. He was accessible, patient and proactive--seeking class input and communication re: issues. The class was demanding but fascinating. It proved very helpful in a later photo class--should go hand in glove with Photo 1.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: He was honestly one of the nicest teachers I met at HVCC. Hes very helpful when it comes to editing your pictures to get that perfect print. The subject matter is also very interesting as well it makes you see photography in a different view. I enjoyed his lectures and the fact he taught the class how to use their cameras and how he challenged us.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: If you are not into art, or photography this may not be the class for you. If you are, you will find it very interesting. He teaches you how to see, which inevitably will make you a better photographer. He does not focus on the technical aspects of photography, but rather the artistic, and compositional.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Great Professor. Gave ideas and then let you free. Assignments shooting around the school were kinda boring but the at home projects were more fun and open to the imagination.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Definitely one of those art people that think they\'re better than everyone else. Plays favourites to the max. Very rude and unapproachable. I don\'t recommend him at all.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: He is open to discussion on pictures he shows yet he can have one sided views on certain things. He lectures a lot and it can be pretty boring if you\'re not an art major.Gives his first test after the first 8 weeks of class. Assignments are boring if, once again, you\'re not an art major. Check for yourself: Hellobilly.com

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I took 21 classes at HVCC to get my A.S. degree and I got an A in every one except this one. Jaeger is a joke. He is a horrible teacher. He should be investigated by the college. No wonder why he is only an adjunct professor; the college won\'t even hire him. His photographs aren\'t that good either. Extremely hard tests. Boring! Avoid at all costs!

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: If you are not an art major do NOT take him. He only grades assignments on creativity, not content. He should stick to taking photos and not teaching. Very boring. Only likes "art" people. He makes you memorize tons of photographers and then gives you impossible tests on them. Basically impossible to get an A in this class. 2 tests. 3 assignments.

tag_professor: Hilarious (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: least compassionate person I\'ve ever met.Not approachable. If he calls your name to answer a question, be sure you get it correct or he\'ll come up with a way to insult you or make you feel like a dumb-a$$ in front of the class.
